pullRequest.body:
`Algebra.CharP.Basic` currently depends on 935 files. This is unacceptably large for such a basic plain algebra file. This PR moves everything that doesn't depend on `Finset` (a seemingly good cut-off point) to a new file `Algebra.CharP.Defs`


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: !bench
Probably worth waiting for the shake before benching!

Bench doesn't run shake (unless there is a recent change). 
- Does it build (even with `sorry`)? 
- Does it lint?
It will probably build and lint. The point of benching *after* shaking is that there should be more parallelism once a bunch of imports have been removed.

Oh I see. With `awaiting-review`, I assumed that this had been done and shake would clean up the stragglers. 

Anyway, we can bench it again afterwards.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/dba3d6d8-5cb8-4b16-b8a2-39772460d7c6) for commit 6447b47e0c7798d6aa3866067c458078a38c023e.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ec28e148-1224-4131-a1b9-ab9e134a24bd/to/dba3d6d8-5cb8-4b16-b8a2-39772460d7c6) against commit a169186c2862ae4ea0801a5c79c0cd0b3f1616d8.
Sorry, I use `awaiting-CI` + `awaiting-review` to mean "`awaiting-review` once `awaiting-CI` is removed". That spares me one manual label manipulation.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a1888946-c526-4aee-965a-da290aa33b82) for commit a5f1ffa93dd4d4f166587700c1a0c984df7ceede.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ec28e148-1224-4131-a1b9-ab9e134a24bd/to/a1888946-c526-4aee-965a-da290aa33b82) against commit a169186c2862ae4ea0801a5c79c0cd0b3f1616d8.

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

P.S.: If someone wants to split the file into smaller pieces, this can be done in another PR.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9040274861/job/24844221913)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9040274861/job/24844222146)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9040274861/job/24844222341)

This split is a good idea! Unfortunately the `Defs` file in this PR doesn't work for my use case (#10765, which has been rotting without comments for months), since it still imports the `ring` tactic. I suppose I'll make a new PR that also splits out everything depending on `import Mathlib.Data.Int.ModEq` which transitively depends on `ring`.
(I am slightly annoyed that I didn't have the chance to complain about this before it got merged, but that's my own life getting in the way these last weeks.)
Oh sorry I didn't know about your PR!
I'd consider keeping this in Basic
Why? `Fin` is in Std now

@Ruben-VandeVelde, in my future PRs I need the instance above and I don't need the junk from `Algebra.CharP.Basic` (which still needs sorting). I think that's a good enough reason to move `Fin.charP` to the more basic file. Further, it does not increase imports.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra/CharP/Basic): Split
